column3: Artificial Intelligence aims to create systems that can perform tasks requiring human intelligence.
Machine Learning is a subset of Artificial Intelligence.
Which type of AI can perform a specific task but lacks generalization?
column6: a) Strong AI b) Narrow AI c) General AI d) Artificial Superintelligence

column3: What is the main goal of supervised learning?
column6: a) To train a model using labeled data b) To find hidden patterns in data c) To generate random predictions d) To create unstructured data

column3: The algorithm that learns by minimizing a cost function using backpropagation is called __.
In reinforcement learning agents learn by interacting with an environment.
A decision tree is a machine learning model used for classification and regression tasks.
Which of the following is a commonly used activation function in neural networks?
column6: a) Linear b) Exponential c) ReLU d) Logarithmic

column3: Which type of AI learns by mimicking the human brainâ€™s neural structure?
column6: a) Genetic Algorithms b) Symbolic AI c) Rule-Based Systems d) Deep Learning

column3: The process of training a machine learning model by updating its parameters iteratively is called __.
Unsupervised learning uses labeled data for training.
Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a field of AI focused on enabling machines to understand human language.
What is the main characteristic of a convolutional neural network (CNN)?
column6: a) It is designed for image processing tasks b) It performs statistical analysis c) It uses decision rules for predictions d) It creates probabilistic models

column3: Which of the following is an example of unsupervised learning?
column6: a) Logistic Regression b) Clustering c) Linear Regression d) Classification

column3: The ability of an AI system to improve itself without explicit programming is called __.
